name: Gothenburg
fun_fact: Fun fact: Gothenburg's Feskek√∂rka (Fish Church) is an indoor fish market built in 1874 that got its name because the building looks exactly like a Gothic church - but inside it's entirely dedicated to the freshest seafood in Scandinavia!

hero_dishes.name: R√§ksm√∂rg√•s
hero_dishes.description: Open-faced shrimp sandwich piled impossibly high with hand-peeled North Sea shrimp, mayo, dill, lemon, and sometimes egg
hero_dishes.origin_story: Gothenburg's location on the west coast makes it Sweden's seafood capital - these sandwiches are an art form here

hero_dishes.name: West Coast Oysters
hero_dishes.description: Fresh oysters from the cold, clean waters of the Swedish archipelago
hero_dishes.origin_story: The nutrient-rich waters where cold and warm currents meet produce exceptional shellfish - served simply with lemon
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Gabriel Restaurant at Feskek√∂rka, Sj√∂magasinet, Beach by Feskek√∂rka

hero_dishes.name: Hallandssill
hero_dishes.description: Pickled herring prepared in numerous traditional ways - mustard, onion, lingonberry
hero_dishes.origin_story: Herring has been essential to Swedish diet for centuries, with each region developing unique preparations
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Feskek√∂rka, Saluhallen Briggen, traditional sm√∂rg√•sbord restaurants

hero_dishes.origin_story: A celebration of everything the Swedish west coast offers from the sea

signature_drinks.name: Swedish Coffee (Fika)
signature_drinks.description: Strong filter coffee, essential to the sacred Swedish fika tradition
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Multiple times daily with kanelbullar (cinnamon buns) or cardamom buns - never rushed

signature_drinks.name: Punsch
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Warm with pea soup on Thursdays (traditional), or cold as a digestif

food_culture_notes: Feskek√∂rka fish market has operated since 1874 - both market and restaurants inside
Fika is sacred - Swedes average 3-4 coffee breaks daily, always with pastry
Sm√∂rg√•sbord originated in Sweden - Gothenburg restaurants serve excellent versions
Thursday is traditionally pea soup and pancake day across Sweden
